definition: Development of nanorobots for medical applications, including tissue repair and diagnostics, essential for advanced medical procedures in cryonics.
tech_readiness: Experimental proof of concept demonstrated; early in vitro functionality achieved, though scalability and control remain challenges.

definition: Techniques to manufacture structures and devices at the atomic level, crucial for building the next generation of medical nanorobots and other precision tools.
tech_readiness: Experimental proof of concept demonstrated; atomic-scale assembly methods show initial promise.

definition: Building complex molecular structures using mechanical manipulation at the atomic scale, a necessary precursor to the development of nanofactories.
tech_readiness: Experimental proof of concept demonstrated; controlled mechanical assembly at atomic scales achieved in preliminary setups.

definition: Factories capable of producing nanotechnology devices and materials, enabling large-scale production of the tools necessary for advanced medical and cryonics applications.
tech_readiness: Technology validated in the lab; early prototypes demonstrate scalable production capabilities.

definition: Proteins that assist in the proper folding of other proteins, crucial for preventing aggregation and ensuring cellular function post-revival.
tech_readiness: Technology validated in the lab; initial in vivo tests show promising improvements in protein folding fidelity.

definition: Advanced delivery systems to transport gene-editing tools (e.g., CRISPR-Cas9) directly to specific cells or tissues, enhancing the precision and efficacy of gene therapies.
tech_readiness: Technology validated in the lab; improved targeting efficiency demonstrated in preliminary animal models.

definition: Sensors utilizing nanopore technology for real-time, high-resolution monitoring of molecular changes within cells and tissues during revival.
tech_readiness: Technology validated in the lab; sensitivity and throughput enhancements have been achieved.

definition: Precision delivery of nanomedicine to targeted cells and tissues, crucial for effectively treating specific areas without affecting surrounding healthy tissues.
tech_readiness: Technology validated in the lab; advanced targeting and controlled release mechanisms validated in pilot studies.

definition: Systems that deliver drugs in response to specific physiological conditions, ensuring that treatments are administered at the right time and place for maximum effectiveness.
tech_readiness: Technology validated in the lab; real-time responsive delivery demonstrated in simulated conditions.

definition: Nanoparticles designed to carry and deliver drugs directly to target cells, enhancing the efficacy of treatments and reducing side effects.
tech_readiness: Technology validated in the lab; improvements in drug loading and targeting have been documented.
